description.en: This compulsory course in the PhD programme prepares new doctoral students for the period of intensive doctoral studies ahead of them. It not only facilitates a clearer sense of the own project and the writing of a dissertation prospectus (to be defended at the end of the first year), but also introduces doctoral candidates to the life of the advanced academic researcher and teacher.
description.et: Doktorantidele on seminarid kohustuslikud. Seminarid aitavad oma teadustööd mõtestada ning ainekursuse lõpuks peab valmima doktoritöö laiendatud kavand, mida kaitstakse avalikult 1. aasta lõpus.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to help PhD students acquire the knowledge, skills and competences that are necessary for successfully completing PhD studies in the field of Political Science and for working as a researcher or top-level specialist in the field.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on aidata doktorandil omandada teadmised, oskused ja pädevused, mis on vajalikud doktoriõppe edukaks läbimiseks politoloogia erialal ning teadlase või tippspetsialisti töös politoloogia valdkonnas.

independent_work.et:
- attend all meetings
- complete the short assignments associated with each meeting
- submit a revised and expanded dissertation prospectus (including substantially developed literature review and methods description sections) by the end of the academic year
- present and defend the expanded prospectus at a seminar attended by faculty, other Ph.D/MA students (in May).
- If considered necessary, re-submit a revised version of your prospectus that will be reviewed by at least two faculty before the first progress review.

description.en: Detailed guidelines for preparing the dissertation prospectus are available on Moodle.
description.et: Detailed guidelines for preparing the dissertation prospectus are available on Moodle.

grade_preconditions.en:
The course is offered on a pass/fail basis. To pass, you should:

 - attend all meetings and complete the short assignments associated with some of them. If you must miss meetings because of illness, important travel, etc, contact us ASAP. If you miss three or more meetings, you will not pass the course this academic year (and will have to attend selected meetings next year).
  - submit a revised and expanded dissertation prospectus (including substantially developed literature review and methods description sections) by the end of the academic year
 - present and defend the expanded prospectus at the Institute's research colloquium attended by faculty, other Ph.D/MA students (in May).
